intro: Astragalus subkohrudicus, commonly known as the Khorasan milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with deep root systems. It plays a role in soil stabilization and is sometimes used in traditional medicine. Its ecological importance is notable in its native habitats.
